body:

body: @cowtowncoder Thank your response! I will provide a PR soon and contact you if questions appear.
Following your comment I just created one against 2.x in my fork.

issue.title: Fixes #601: Jackson subtype schema unions are non-deterministic

labels.name: cla-received
labels.description: Marker to denote that there is a CLA for pr

repository.name: jackson-dataformats-binary
repository.description: Uber-project for standard Jackson binary format backends: avro, cbor, ion, protobuf, smile

issue.body:
(fixes: #601)

With the current implementation of the `RecordVisitor`, Avro schema unions are handled in a non-deterministic way. This can cause deserialization errors when different `AvroMapper` instances are used for serialization and deserialization.

Specifically, because the subtype ordering is unstable, deserialization may attempt to resolve a serialized object against the wrong subtype, resulting in errors.

This PR makes the ordering deterministic by using an `ArrayList` instead of a `Set`, ensuring consistent behavior across serialization and deserialization.

rename.from: Jackson subtype Avro schema unions are non-deterministic and therefore incompatible with each other.
rename.to: Jackson subtype Avro schema unions are non-deterministic and therefore incompatible with each other

body:
Ok, fix (via #613) merged in 2.x, backported in 2.20 (for 2.20.1). Tried 2.19 but cherry-pick did not go cleanly & simple resolve resulted in failing test.
If anyone wants to try separate PR against 2.19, happy to get one merged. But for now fix just for 2.20 and later.

issue.title: Fixes #601: Jackson subtype schema unions are non-deterministic (#613)

repository.name: jackson-dataformats-binary
repository.description: Uber-project for standard Jackson binary format backends: avro, cbor, ion, protobuf, smile
